column5: First bow of the season guys and gals!.....Hopefully a sign of things to come! This fish was taken on a #7 panther martin in a "salamander pattern', water was 12deg celcius.                       Tight lines!  Pic in the next post.....oops, sorry!
seems pretty dark... from a superior trib i presume?
For sure, I was almost wondering if it was a resident?
Very nice. It almost looks like a Chinook. Nice little stream there. It must be loaded with trout.
Nice fish and good start to the bow season. I'm itchy all of a sudden:dunno:
Actually, not much more than a 100 yards or so down river, it's pretty deep and slow,and also full of toothy critters, which love to feed on fingerlings!
I caught a few bows there way back in the day mid summer. I would assume resident being the color. Good first fish! can't wait to get home and join ya!
You're blind if you think that's a chinook.
Great looking bow Congrats eazy Thanks for sharing Leechman
Thanks!....Hopefully a sign of things to come!.....Gotta love the way they slam the hardware!
